reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this resortin Noci as we wanted to stay close to Alberobello, but not in the town. It is a perfect location for exploring the countryside. We had a Junior suite with it's charming bed under the conical roof of the trulli, a living room, bath and a second bedroom (which we used for our luggage). There was a table and 4 chairs outside in a private walled patio just steps from the very large and well maintained pool. The suite was charming, clean, and spacious. The shower was a little small, but not uncomfortable, and no smaller than many 4 star hotels in Italy. We only ate breakfast at the restaurant adjoining the hotel, so I can't comment on it's quality, other than breakfast was more than adequate. Proprietors are welcoming and helpful, grounds beautiful, location quiet and peaceful and a short drive into town. Well worth the money.
reviews.title: I'd go back in a minute!

reviews.text: One of the best stays I have had anywhere. We were there for a wedding, staying four nights, and cannot fault one thing. Angelika (reception) & Marco (Restaurant) were particularly helpful, but the level of service throughout was top notch. And the resort itself is just beautiful. We stayed in one of the trullis, but the other rooms were just as good.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The pool is huge, and the food fabulous, even by Puglian standards.
reviews.title: Wonderful and relaxing vacation!

reviews.text: I travelled with my entire family- 9 people ranging in age from 70 to 6 years old. Each and every one one of us had a wonderful stay at Abate Masseria. Mino and his entire staff were welcoming and warm. It was a peaceful stay, total relaxation. The pool is incredibly large and beautiful. The seating (a mix of regular and lounge chairs) was plentiful and provided the option of either sunning or sitting in the shade of the beautiful trees surrounding it. The rooms were pristine- quiet and private. Some of us stayed in the trulli, others in the comfort rooms. Both types were incredibly charming and super clean. A lot of attention to detail was put into every inch. The restaurant served fabulous food. It is a little far to walk into town, but I wouldn't let that be a deterrent from staying here. I work in the hospitality industry and was impressed in every way with this property. Thank you to the entire staff for a wonderful vacation!
reviews.title: excellent excellent excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An absolutely stellar resort. I was here for a week with my parents in June, and it is hands down, one of the best (if not THE best) places that I have ever stayed. If you want to take a break from the big cities, and experience the Italian countryside, this is the place. Great location to explore Puglia (I highly suggest you check out Alberobello, Locorotondo, Martina Franca, Lecce, Matera, the Castellana Grotto, Bari Vecchia). Trulli converted into comfortable, spacious, modern rooms, beautiful pool, gardens, fantastic breakfast buffet and restaurant. The most helpful, kind, courteous, warm, friendy staff you will ever meet....Mino, Christina, Angelica, Marco, you made us feel like family from the moment we arrived until the day we left, and made it an unforgettable experience. Thank you so much! Brian
reviews.title: beautiful suites in trulli, beautiful, big pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel offers comfortable rooms, a quiet location, nice gardens and a lovely spotless (if rather cold) pool. The staff are extremely helpful. Good food - breakfasts were much better than we expected in Italy.
reviews.title: Top notch place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's website does not do the place justice.
reviews.title: Faultless client care

reviews.text: If all hotels cared about their clients the way Mino and Christina do at Abate Masseria then the world would always be travelling. One example: we forgot the map to get to the hotel, and when we rang them on the outskirts of Noci, Mino kindly talked us all the way into the hotel, corner by corner, road by road and strode out to greet us when we arrived.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Abate Masseria is a small but lovely hotel. The pool and surrounding areas are peaceful and well kept, with decent- sized and exceptionally clean rooms (with aircon) , a very fairly priced minibar, excellent pool service and a restaurant on site (albeit owned by another party). Worth noting that a car is essential to get around. As mentioned by another traveller, the restaurant does occasionally hold an evening function and it might intrude a little. If you want to be sure of peace then stay in one of the trulli (walls are trulli thick!)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most outstanding feature of the hotel though is the friendliness of the owners and their sheer passion to ensure that all guests have a wonderful stay. I would have no hesitation to return.
reviews.title: Utterly relaxing
Enchanting oasis
reviews.text: This is one of the most pleasant and relaxing hotels I ever stayed. The breakfast buffet is the best I had so far in Italy, with excellent local products like the mozzarella di Pugla, several types of ham and cheeses, cereals, fruit from their own garden, mouthwatering home-made cakes. Marco even knows how to make a good tea, a rarity in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Angelica at the reception is the soul of the place, friendly, helpful and speaks well English. So are the owners of the hotel. They make you feel at home in a non-intrusive way, but they are there when you need help or advise. When booking the hotel I first hesitated because it is located outside Noci (about 35 minutes walk to the town centre). But when calling them on the day of my arrival, they offered me immediately to collect me from the train station and they also gave me a lift back upon my departure. But once you are there you don't feel any urge to leave the place anyway. The rooms are large, well furnished and equipped and the trulli-rooms are very special and romantic. Every room has it's own forecourt with table and chairs, were they serve everything, if you ask them. Their restaurant is very good (listed in the Micheline Guide), not expensive and you can order only one dish, if you are not too hungry. On the only day the restaurant was closed Angelica took me with her own car to a good restaurant near Noci, and collected me after lunch to take me back to the hotel! What more can you ask for? This is definitely a great place if you want to relax and need peace and quiet. I will return as soon as I have again an opportunity to come back to lovely Puglia!
reviews.title: unusual but well designed and maintained small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: although having only eight rooms, rthis establishment also has a pool and a michelin recommended restaurant. The rooms are either in converted trullis or in as sxmall converted stable block. They are spacious and well equipped. if there is a drawback, it is that the restautrant is shut on sundays and therfe are few other eating places nearby or in the town of Noci, but don't let that put you off. This a classy establishment and staffed by friendly helpful people who cant do enough for you
reviews.title: Wonderful trullo and perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During a week driving around Puglia, we decided that a few days in a trullo might be in order. I wanted somewhere from which I could explore many of the 'must see' towns and sights in central Puglia. After extensive research, I chose the Abate Masseria and what a gem it turned out to be.
reviews.title: Idyllic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't let the word 'resort' put you off. It's small, discreet and beautifully manicured. Our trullo was a shock - many times better than I had anticipated. The interior comprised a fabulous bathroom, a sumptuous living room and a curtained archway through to a hugely comfortable bedroom area. The feeling was that of a four star suite within an elegantly styled and attractively constructed multi-roofed trullo. Everything was tastefully thought through. Quality linen, a giant bed and hugely efficient air conditioning/heating units.
reviews.title: Quite and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Abate Masseria is a great place to stay if you want to spend your holidays in Puglia.
reviews.title: Gracefully hospitality and quietness combined to kindness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a refined and hospitable resort, staff is very professional but kind so you feel at home.
reviews.title: Paradise in Puglia

reviews.text: Trulli restoration is accurate, as well all details: swimming pool and bar open air are perfect for relaxing.
reviews.title: Ideal base for exploring northern Puglia

reviews.text: Breakfast is another special moment, buffet is wonderful and as always kindness and elegance are in everything.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back for sure

reviews.text: We stayed just 2 night because of we're travelling around the region but living in Trullo dell'Ulivo with an open view on an endless olive tree expanse was one of the most magic moment in our holiday.
reviews.title: Wonderful, personal hotel
